title: Conor McGregor is looking for an 'easy way back' into UFC, says rival Dustin Poirier
text:
Conor McGregor is looking for the easiest comeback fight possible, according to UFC rival Dustin Poirier.

McGregor has not fought since losing against Khabib Nurmagomedov last October, but continues to flirt with a return to the octagon before the end of the year.

Poirier is a potential opponent for McGregor, but the Irishman appears to have his eyes firmly set on facing veteran fighter Frankie Edgar after suggesting the two will meet in December.

Conor McGregor has not fought in the Octagon since his loss to Khabib in October 2018

Frankie Edgar boasts a MMA record of 23-7-1 and lost his last fight to Max Holloway in July

Dustin Poirier believes McGregor's calling out Edgar because he wants 'favourable' return fight

Edgar lost his last fight against Max Holloway at featherweight, meaning he would have to jump up a weight division to face former lightweight champion McGregor.

Poirier believes calling out Edgar, who recently turned 38, is evidence that McGregor is looking for an easy way back into the sport.

'Frankie's a tough guy and a great champion, but I think he lost his last two fights and was planning on moving down to 135 pounds,' he told ESPN.

'All respect to Frankie, but it's kind of maybe a more favourable fight, McGregor might have thought.'

Both fighters called on UFC President Dana White to make the fight happen in December

But UFC president White insisted that he has no intentions to make the fight happen

However, the prospects of McGregor facing Edgar appear slim after UFC president Dana White revealed he has no intentions to make the fight.

He said: 'Conor loves to fight and wants to fight again, but that Frankie Edgar fight isn't going to happen.

'Edgar is two weight classes below him. Edgar is in a position; he was supposed to fight Aljamain Sterling, and Aljamain fell out, got hurt.

'Frankie's coming to the end of his career and he could end up getting himself into a title position again. So to take the Conor fight makes no sense.'
description: Poirier is a potential opponent for McGregor, but the Irishman appears to have his eyes firmly set on facing veteran fighter Frankie Edgar after suggesting the two will meet in December.
